docs.snippet: Mrs. Clinton’s second presidential bid seems to amount to a series of high-dollar fund-raisers with public appearances added to the schedule when they can be fit in....
docs.lead_paragraph: Mrs. Clinton’s second presidential bid seems to amount to a series of high-dollar fund-raisers with public appearances added to the schedule when they can be fit in.
docs.abstract: Hillary Clinton has aggressively courted moneyed donors over course of summer, appearing at events and benefits in nation's most moneyed enclaves; campaign raised about $143 million in August, its best month to date; while Clinton has made broad effort to appeal to ordinary voters, her appearances before them are largely scheduled between events catering to elite and longtime donors, among whom she appears most comfortable.

headline.main: Where Has Hillary Clinton Been? Ask the Ultrarich
headline.print_headline: Clinton Uses Access to Woo the Ultrarich

docs.lead_paragraph: Donald Trump’s first general election ad focused on immigration, and his new one, titled “Two Americas: Economy,” is about jobs.
docs.abstract: Ad of the Week column; latest general election ad from Donald Trump's campaign focuses on jobs, portraying decimated American labor force under Hillary Clinton and promising millions of new jobs under Trump administration.

docs.abstract: Commission on Presidential Debates announces Lester Holt Martha Raddatz, Anderson Cooper and Chris Wallace have been selected to moderate presidential debates in 2016; Elaine Quijano has been selected to moderate vice-presidential debate.

docs.abstract: Discord builds in relationship between Donald J Trump and Republican National Committee as fiery tone of his speech on migrant criminals opens new wound, threatening Trump's relationship with his most important political alliance; collaboration between staff members for Trump campaign and RNC is also faltering in crucial phase of presidential campaign.
